result.execSummary:
The defendant Terence Delynn Maclin Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 2/19/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 25 days time served. This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terence Delynn Maclin Jr

ADDRESS INFO for Terence Delynn Maclin Jr

Prior: 6048 North 61 Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218
REFUND PACKET

Defendant Terence Delynn Maclin in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
On motion of the State, Court amended the charge to Possession of THC, pusuant to Wis Stat 961.41(3g)(e), an unclassified misdemeanor.
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 25 days time served.  This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 2/19/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
**Court denied request to have case expunged.
Court released jury panel.

14RM036109  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/22/2014

Defendant Terence Delynn Maclin in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant appears in court on a violation.  Defendant has tested positive for THC.  Statements by counsel.  Court finds the defendant has failed to comply with monitoring.  Court orders $500 of the bail FORFEITED.  Bail remains the same.  Defendant to post another $500 cash TOT to Justice Point with the same conditions.  Case remains set for 8-5-14.
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defense moves to have the GPS monitoring amended to include testing at the Department of Motor Vehicles.  Statements by counsel.  Court grants motion and amends GPS monitoring to include that the defendant go to the DMV for the written and road tests in order to obtain his driver's license.

Attorney Bridge Krause appears with Mary Guimont and defendant.  

Attorney Krause states due to the conflict of interest that required Attorney Morrisey to withdraw would pertain to Attorney Johnson as well.  Case should have been appointed to outside counsel.  Court cancels the jury trial for 7-9-14 and allows Attorney Johnson to withdraw as counsel.  Case remains set for status of counsel.

Defendant Terence Delynn Maclin in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Terence Delynn Maclin in custody.  Paul Hauer for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD Detective.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #12CM370 that are attached to the complaint.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Terence Delynn Maclin in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Terence Delynn Maclin in custody.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Defense wishes to address bail at next court date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
